p: However, a greater information could be observed from the PCA analysis, which resulted in an efficient subdivision of the group III (previously obtained from HCA) in two groups (III and IV, Figure 5B). A higher similarity between the genotype X2M1 and X6M15 was observed Figure 5B and the compounds α-guaiene ( 48), α-bulnesene ( 59), α-humulene ( 49), germacrene D ( 54), and ( E)-caryophyllene ( 46) could be pinpointed from the PCA biplot graph as the responsible for such similarities Figure 5C. Indeed, those genotypes disclosed the highest percentage of sesquiterpenes hydrocarbon among the samples Table 2.
